intro: Diplostephium subincisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. Its leaves are narrow and deeply lobed, with a rough, textured surface. The flowers are small and clustered in yellowish-green cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
